lines.speaker: Soothsayer

lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.value: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.value: MENAS

lines.value: Than drink so much in one.

lines.value: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.value: In thy fats our cares be drown'd,
lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.value: With thy grapes our hairs be crown'd:
lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.value: Cup us, till the world go round,

lines.value: Cup us, till the world go round!

lines.value: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: What would you more? Pompey, good night. Good brother,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: Let me request you off: our graver business
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: Frowns at this levity. Gentle lords, let's part;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: You see we have burnt our cheeks: strong Enobarb
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: Is weaker than the wine; and mine own tongue
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: Splits what it speaks: the wild disguise hath almost
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: Antick'd us all. What needs more words? Good night.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.value: Good Antony, your hand.

lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: O Silius, Silius,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: I have done enough; a lower place, note well,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: May make too great an act: for learn this, Silius;
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Better to leave undone, than by our deed
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Acquire too high a fame when him we serve's away.
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Caesar and Antony have ever won
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: More in their officer than person: Sossius,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: One of my place in Syria, his lieutenant,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: For quick accumulation of renown,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Which he achieved by the minute, lost his favour.
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Who does i' the wars more than his captain can
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Becomes his captain's captain: and ambition,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: The soldier's virtue, rather makes choice of loss,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Than gain which darkens him.
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: I could do more to do Antonius good,
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: But 'twould offend him; and in his offence
lines.speaker: VENTIDIUS

lines.value: Should my performance perish.

lines.speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: To public ear:
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIA

lines.value: O my good lord,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: Believe not all; or, if you must believe,

lines.value: Stomach not all. A more unhappy lady,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: If this division chance, ne'er stood between,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: Praying for both parts:
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: The good gods me presently,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: When I shall pray, 'O bless my lord and husband!'
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: Undo that prayer, by crying out as loud,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: 'O, bless my brother!' Husband win, win brother,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: Prays, and destroys the prayer; no midway
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: 'Twixt these extremes at all.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: MARK ANTONY
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: Gentle Octavia,
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: Let your best love draw to that point, which seeks
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: Best to preserve it: if I lose mine honour,
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: I lose myself: better I were not yours
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: Than yours so branchless. But, as you requested,
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: Yourself shall go between 's: the mean time, lady,
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: I'll raise the preparation of a war
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: Shall stain your brother: make your soonest haste;
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: So your desires are yours.
lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIA
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: Thanks to my lord.

lines.value: The Jove of power make me most weak, most weak,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: Your reconciler! Wars 'twixt you twain would be
lines.speaker: OCTAVIA

lines.value: MARK ANTONY

lines.speaker: MARK ANTONY
